official-title.#text: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish small business savings accounts.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Savings Accounts for a Variable Economy for Small Businesses Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Savings Accounts for a Variable Economy for Small Businesses Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 section:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
under this section to
			 establish a small business savings account with respect to such business
			 under terms which meet the requirements of this section.

text.#text: Any eligible small business may enter into an agreement with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may by regulation prescribe.

term.#tail:
means a tax preferred savings account which is designated at the time of establishment of the plan
			 as a small business savings account. Such designation shall be made in
			 such manner as the

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

There shall be allowed as a deduction an amount equal to the contributions to a small business
			 savings account for the taxable year.

The aggregate amount of contributions for any taxable year to all small business savings accounts
			 maintained for the benefit of an eligible small business shall not exceed
			 an amount equal to 10 percent of the gross profits of the business for the
			 preceding taxable year.

Any qualified distribution from a small business savings account shall not be includible in gross
			 income.

Any amounts distributed out of a small business savings account that are not qualified
			 distributions shall be included in gross income for the taxable year of
			 the distribution.
For purposes of this subsection—

			 reinvestment of such distribution for the funding of worker hiring or
			 financial stabilization for the purposes of job retention or creation.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, in consultation with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Small Business Administration

,
			 for each specified period of economic hardship establish a distribution
			 limitation for qualified distributions from eligible small business
			 accounts with respect to such period. The aggregate qualified
			 distributions for any such period from all accounts with respect to an
			 eligible small business shall not exceed such limitation.

text.#text: The

			 distribution other than a qualified distribution in the taxable year of

text.#text: Any distribution not used in the manner certified under

Any amount contributed to a small business savings account (and any earnings attributable thereto),
			 once distributed, shall not be treated as a qualified distribution unless
			 such distribution is made not later than 8 years after the date of such
			 contribution. For purposes of the preceding sentence, amounts (and the
			 earnings attributable thereto) shall be treated as distributed on a
			 first-in first-out basis.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(relating to imposition of tax on unrelated business income
			 of charitable, etc. organizations).

text.#text:
Any small business savings account is exempt from taxation under this subtitle A unless such
			 account has ceased to be a small business savings account. Notwithstanding
			 the preceding sentence, any such account is subject to the taxes imposed
			 by
For purposes of this section—

term.#tail:
means, with respect to any calendar year, any person if the annual average number of full-time
			 employees employed by such person during the preceding calendar year was
			 50 or fewer. For purposes of the preceding sentence, a preceding calendar
			 year may be taken into account only if the person was in existence
			 throughout the year.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means, with respect to any year, an employee who is employed on average at least 40 hours of
			 service per week.

text.#text: The term

, shall prescribe such regulations,
			 rules, and guidance as may be necessary to determine the hours of service
			 of an employee, including rules for the application of this paragraph to
			 employees who are not compensated on an hourly basis.

text.#text: Rules similar to the rules of

If, during any taxable year of the eligible small business for whose benefit an account is
			 established, the account or any portion thereof is pledged as security for
			 a loan, the portion so pledged shall be treated as distributed in a
			 distribution other than a qualified distribution.

header.#text: Effect of pledging account as security

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a program to administer small business savings
			 accounts under

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish minimum standards for small business savings accounts and shall
			 establish accounts within the

or enter into
			 agreements with trustees that meet these standards to administer such
			 accounts. In establishing such standards and making such agreements the

shall, to the extent practicable, seek to minimize fees,
			 minimize risk of loss of principal, and ensure a range of investment risk
			 options available to account beneficiaries.
